title: 2011 Dutch National Track Championships – Women's keirin
text:
The women's <a href="keirin">keirin</a> at the <a href="2011%20Dutch%20National%20Track%20Championships">2011 Dutch National Track Championships</a> in <a href="Apeldoorn">Apeldoorn</a> took place at <a href="Omnisport%20Apeldoorn">Omnisport Apeldoorn</a> on December 29, 2011. 13 athletes participated in the contest.
<a href="Willy%20Kanis">Willy Kanis</a> won the gold medal, <a href="Yvonne%20Hijgenaar">Yvonne Hijgenaar</a> took silver and <a href="Shanne%20Braspennincx">Shanne Braspennincx</a> won the bronze.
Competition format.
The Keirin races involved 5.5 laps of the track behind a motorcycle, followed by a 2.5 lap sprint to the finish. The tournament consisted of a semi-finals round, repechages and the finals. The top two cyclists in each semi-final advanced to the final, with the rest of the cyclists competing again in the repechage. Two of those cyclists advanced from the two repechage to the final as well, for a total of 6 finalists. The other riders competed in the 7th to 13th place classification race.
Results.
Final results.
Results from uci.ch and nkbaanwielrennen.nl.
